question: Which country houses the "Abul-Samsari Range"?
explanation: Abul-Samsari Range is a volcanic range in southern Georgia, southwest of Tbilisi. It is a part of the Lesser Caucasus Mountains and rises above the Javakheti and Tsalka Plateaus. The range itself is 40 km long and runs north to south from the Ktsia to the Paravani River Gorges. The highest mountain is Didi Abuli at an elevation of 3,301 m above sea level. The slopes of the Abul-Samsari Range are mainly covered with alpine meadows and grasslands.
